The tryal and condemnation of Sir John Friend, Knight for conspiring to raise rebellion in these kingdoms : in order to a French invasion : who upon full evidence was found guilty of high-treason at the sessions-house in the Old Bayly, March 23th, 1695/6. Friend, John, Sir, d. 1696.
[2], 35 [i.e. 31] p.
Printed for Brabazon Aylmer ..., London : M DC XCVI [1696]
Contains numerous errors in pagination. Reproduction of original in the British Library.
